snippet: The increasingly fractious relationship between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York and Mayor Bill de Blasio will be tested further over the next month as the state budget is finalized.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's appearance at a pro-charter school rally is latest example of his increasingly fractious relationship with New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio; Cuomo has stymied the mayor repeatedly since his inauguration, and has seized the chance to burnish his own political brand as a moderate Democrat and tax cutter; strain is likely to mount as state budget is finalized.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN, SUSANNE CRAIG and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan and Susanne Craig reported from Albany, and Michael M. Grynbaum from New York.

lead_paragraph: The increasingly fractious relationship between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York and Mayor Bill de Blasio will be tested further over the next month as the state budget is finalized.

headline.main: Cuomo Burnishes His Political Brand, Using de Blasio as His Foil
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Burnishes His Brand, Using Mayor as Foil
